intro: Epidorkis brachystepis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disc flowers. The plant typically grows as a low, spreading shrub with gray-green, narrow leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom during the cooler months. Epidorkis brachystepis is adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
